data.title: Cannot Open TS Server Log File if it Grows Too Large
data.body: The Open TS Server log file stops working if the log file grows too large. We should reveal the file in the finder in these cases

data.title: Cmd-W closes tabs when About window has focus

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When viewing the Code > About window, Cmd-W closes the open tab, not the About window, despite the About window having focus.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 (1.11.2)
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.4 (16E195)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a tab.
2. Click the Code menu.
3. Click the About menu item.
4. Press Cmd-W.

data.title: Can no longer remove single matches from search results
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.0 (72672be0b7d3eef0784077b880615f91b7ec85aa, 2017-05-04T16:10:14.237Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

You can still remove an entire file's matches. When you reveal the replace text box you can remove them again. Seems inconsistent.

data.title: Debug Hover Widget Not Themed
data.body:
In debug mode, the variable hover widget does not appear to be themeable

![a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/25716236/3cc1fa76-30b3-11e7-9597-19cac5e97cc8.png)

I tested out our builtin themes but all seemed to be using the standard light/dark background colors

data.title: 'Go to File' lists non-existent files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|latex-workshop|James-Yu|2.2.1|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|vscode-wakatime|WakaTime|1.1.4|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.14.1|
|numbered-bookmarks|alefragnani|0.9.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.9|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|2.0.3|
|ocaml|hackwaly|0.6.27|
|haskell-linter|hoovercj|0.0.6|
|vscode-ghc-mod|hoovercj|1.2.0|
|language-haskell|justusadam|2.1.1|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.6.0|
|vscode-gtm|s3ramsay|0.2.0|
|stylish-haskell|vigoo|0.0.8|
|vim|vscodevim|0.6.20|;


---

Somehow, for some files I get capitalized duplicates:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/493741/25714138/57be2cac-30f7-11e7-8305-fa06181fea9a.png)
Both entries open the same file (there's only one file `printable.ml`). For the capitalized entry, the tab-title is also capitalized, but it highlights the correct (lowercase) file in the explorer.
The strange thing is that this only happens for some files (in this folder only for the last three files, not the rest).

data.title: Golden-ratio split view
data.body:
Not sure if this is supposed to be done in the core or as a new plugin, but I'd like to have a way to auto-resize the current split-view according to the golden ratio, like done by the golden-ratio vim plugin: https://github.com/roman/golden-ratio

It should also have a keyboard shortcut that would easily toggle it on/off in case we want to have the normal evenly split view.

data.title: cannot access fromCache of undefined.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13-Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

At least one user complain that whenever he opens a file, he can see below exception

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/25712420/802436ba-30a6-11e7-95fe-2073b04d1a6a.png)

The good part is there is only one place that we access it https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/search/browser/openAnythingHandler.ts#L349

data.title: Must type the same letter twice when one letter is selected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (0834f15e86ef8359da9fbcf95d49083001af65c3, 2017-05-03T15:02:36.792Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-75-generic
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. select a letter
2. type the selected letter (nothing happens)
3. type the selected letter again (the letter will finally be typed)

Real example - rename `i` to `idx`

1. select all three `i` variables
2. type `idx` (only `dx` will appear)
2. type `iidx` (first `i` won't appear)
```
for (var i = 0; i < length; i++) {
}
```

data.title: Unmark file as changed if latest change makes file equal to the version on disk
data.body:
Hello!
Example: open any file, put a space anywhere and remove it right away. Suggested behaviour is to remove the "dirty" flag when you remove the changes by hand, not by "Undo" function. This is how it works by default in Atom. Having a "dirty" file that actually isn't changed introduces confusion.

Thanks!

data.title: [Feature Request] History of files opened feature
data.body: It would be useful, especially when examining large projects, to keep a history of files opened. Much like a web browser's history feature. This would be related to, but distinct from, version control because it would track files that were merely opened but not changed.

data.title: Stop rendering pseudo-italic fonts when italic is not available

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When using fonts which don't have italic variants, such as Fira Mono, VScode renders them anyway, using a simple skew. Goes the same for emojis.

This looks quite bad, and should be avoided.

data.title: JSDoc: pasting text should automatically add * in front of each line
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Creators update

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type `/**` followed by enter: this creates a JSDoc comment block
2. Typing `enter` will then add `*` in front of each line

However, pasting some text won't automatically add `*` in front of each line that was pasted into a jsdoc block.

![vscodejsdoc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199648/25704670/b559d3b0-30da-11e7-9753-174ab260371d.gif)

data.title: Suggest: documentation keyboard scrolling doesn't work
data.body:
Related to #25812

> To use page up and down in the docs, press `ctrl+space` and then page up and down as usual

This doesn't work at all for me. I'm on macOS.

data.title: Suggest: Strange wrapping of documentation for `ArrayBuffer`
data.body:
Related to #25812

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/25703654/b62e8aa0-30d6-11e7-8a97-d053a251670d.png)

Is the widget doing this, or does TypeScript really return `\n` characters?

data.title: Context menu for tabs should include rename option
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: All

When I need to rename a file I'm working on, it would be nice to be able to do so from the right-click menu on its tab. Currently you can Reveal in Sidebar and then right-click to rename, but it would be nice to have Rename and even Delete options in the tab's context menu.

data.title: restartTask does not restart task
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run a task that invokes a gulp watcher.
2. Attempt to restart the task using `workbench.action.tasks.restartTask`

VS Code will show a notification stating "The task is already active and in watch mode. To terminate the task use `F1 > terminate task`". But I don't want to *terminate*, I want to *restart*.

The cherry on top is that the task is actually terminated by this :P

> The task 'Build and watch' was terminated per user request.

data.title: Copy/replace/add left <-> right in compare views

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In the compare views, it would be nice to have 

* "Copy to left/right"
* "Replace left (with right)/right (with left)"
* "Add above/down left/right"

in *all* views, i.e. the side-by-side and the unified view (there with other text than "left/right").

Now, I need to select the text and copy-paste it. In the unified view, I even can't select the text from the compared file ("left" file in side-by-side view).

A nice UI would be the one as in [Meld](http://meldmerge.org/):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5795847/25697422/2cdf426e-30bb-11e7-91ba-af67bdebe88d.png)

Related: #24390 (but only wanted for staging VCS diffs)
Blocked by: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4180 ?

data.title: "Open with code" actions and PATH are not set for other accounts of a computer after install

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

When you install with an admin account that isn't your main account.
the "Open with code" action are applied on the account which install vscode.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24956907/25699046/d2741d02-30c1-11e7-952f-c8cb0667ac46.png)

My main account is not the admin account that installed vscode
"Open with code" action to Windows Explorer file context menu,
"Open with code" action to Windows Explorer directory context menu,
Add code to PATH,
are not set to my account

Can you add a menu entry in vscode for setting the following actions for the current user that is running vscode afterward

"Open with code" action to Windows Explorer file context menu
"Open with code" action to Windows Explorer directory context menu
Add code to PATH

data.title: Network: issues with network drives open mapped via Novell Client

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro, Version 1607, Build 1439.1006
- Installed Extensions: xyz.plsql-language (Does not matter if enabled or disabled)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code
2. Open a folder on a networkdrive mapped via Microfocus (former Novell) Client for Open Enterprise Server 2 SP4 (IR3)
3. Share the pain for having to use this client

The following message is given in the dev tools console after start or when trying to open a folder on the mapped directory (Q:\):

 index.js:36 [uncaught exception]: Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, lstat 'Q:\'

Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, lstat 'Q:\'
    at Error (native)onError @ index.js:36
index.js:39 Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, lstat 'Q:\'

Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, lstat 'Q:\'
    at Error (native)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:28:5330onError @ index.js:39
errors.ts:33 Uncaught Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, lstat 'Q:\'

Error: UNKNOWN: unknown error, lstat 'Q:\'
    at Error (native)

data.title: Hash Sum mismatch
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2-1492070517
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.0.4.2

1. Steps to Reproduce:

Run command : 
```
$ sudo apt update
...
E: Failed to fetch http://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode/dists/stable/main/binary-amd64/Packages.bz2  Hash Sum mismatch
```

2. The steps that have been tried : 

```
$ sudo rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

$ sudo apt clean

$ sudo apt update
...
E: Failed to fetch http://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode/dists/stable/main/binary-amd64/Packages.bz2  Hash Sum mismatch
```

Thanks

data.title: Suggest: widget is disconnected from the cursor, when in far right view
data.body:
Related to #25812

In this case, `abstract` doesn't have any documentation. Due to the layout code, the suggest widget appears far to the right of where the cursor is.

The suggestion list should always be as vertically aligned as possible to the cursor position.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/25703577/67961228-30d6-11e7-8ee1-6b47491c50bd.png)

A little bit more indented:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/25703603/8b054cec-30d6-11e7-806c-bcf2152581a7.png)

data.title: Suggest: Text completions show empty documentation box

Related to #25812

Notice the line here:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/25697888/00241932-30bd-11e7-9049-cd04e2df7a75.png)

data.title: [Feature request] Take into account location information in paths when following them in the terminal
data.body: rustc produces error messages with paths formatted like `src\librustc\ty\instance.rs:61:31`. Currently I can Ctrl+Click to go to the file. It would be nice if it could also go to line 61, column 31.

data.title: VSCODE Keeps corrupting Git
data.body:
Version 1.11.2
Commit 6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
Date 2017-04-13T08:01:14.464Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Since updating to the latest version, my .git directory keeps corrupting (I perform commits and push functions through the vscode editor), not quite sure what other logs or information are required, but its becoming very annoying, not seen any other similar issues, but on all my git repo's I run, I only commit/comment one via VSCODE and it keeps corrupting.
